content:
Certainly! Here are some lesser-known filmmakers with unique styles and visions that you may find interesting:

1. Anna Rose Holmer - Known for her coming-of-age drama "The Fits," which explores issues of identity and conformity through the lens of a young female boxer.

2. Barry Jenkins - Known for his films "Moonlight" and "If Beale Street Could Talk," which explore themes of race, sexuality, and family in unique and powerful ways.

3. Chloé Zhao - Known for her soulful character explorations in "The Rider" and "Nomadland," as well as her poetic visual style.

4. Céline Sciamma - Known for her emotionally rich dramas, including "Portrait of a Lady on Fire" and "Water Lilies," which explore themes of desire, identity, and coming-of-age.

5. Robert Eggers - Known for his horror films "The Witch" and "The Lighthouse," which feature distinct visual styles and explore themes of isolation, madness, and the supernatural.

I hope you find this list helpful!
